excavationSites.title: Nalanda University
excavationSites.description: Ancient center of learning that attracted scholars from all over Asia. A UNESCO World Heritage Site, it was the world's first residential university, flourishing from the 5th to 13th century with monasteries, stupas, and a vast library.

excavationSites.title: Vikramashila
excavationSites.description: Another great seat of Buddhist learning with stupas and viharas. Founded by Pala king Dharmapala in the 8th-9th century, it rivaled Nalanda as a major Mahavihara, specializing in Tantric Buddhism.

excavationSites.title: Patliputra
excavationSites.description: Capital of the Mauryan Empire with palatial ruins and ancient pillars. Known as Pataliputra in ancient times, it was one of the largest cities in the world during the Mauryan era, featuring massive wooden fortifications and the famous 80-pillared hall.

excavationSites.title: Rohtasgarh Fort
excavationSites.description: Massive medieval fort with underground structures and battle remains. Perched on a hilltop, it was a strategic stronghold with ancient origins, later used by rulers like Sher Shah Suri and Mughal governors.

excavationSites.title: Rajgir Hills
excavationSites.description: Rich archaeological remains of Buddhist and Jain heritage. Ancient capital of Magadha, encircled by cyclopean walls and hills where Buddha delivered many sermons; features hot springs and ancient fortifications.

excavationSites.title: Telhara Monastery
excavationSites.description: Buddhist monastery ruins linked to ancient Magadha's monastic tradition. Mentioned by Chinese traveler Xuanzang as Teladhaka, it was a significant Mahavihara active from the 1st to 12th century with multiple monasteries.

explorationActivities.title: Rohtasgarh Tunnel Study
explorationActivities.description: Ongoing study on underground tunnels in Rohtasgarh by historians. Exploring the fort's hidden passages and structures for insights into medieval defense and architecture.

explorationActivities.title: Chausa Excavation
explorationActivities.description: Discovery of coins, seals, and terracotta figurines from the Gupta period. Famous for the Chausa bronze hoard of Jain images, one of the earliest metal artifact collections in the Gangetic valley.

explorationActivities.title: Kesaria Stupa Mapping
explorationActivities.description: GIS-based exploration of the massive Kesaria Buddhist stupa in East Champaran. The tallest excavated stupa in the world (104 ft), linked to Buddha's alms bowl gift and expanded from Ashoka's era.

explorationActivities.title: Sasaram Tombs Documentation
explorationActivities.description: Ongoing digital documentation of Sher Shah Suri's tomb and related sites. A stunning octagonal mausoleum in a lake, exemplifying Indo-Islamic architecture from the Sur Empire.

explorationActivities.title: Nalanda Digital Reconstruction
explorationActivities.description: 3D mapping and AR visualization efforts by the Archaeological Survey of India. Reviving the ancient university's layout through modern technology for education and tourism.
explorationActivities.location: Nalanda University Ruins, Nalanda District, Bihar

explorationActivities.title: Vikramshila River Excavation
explorationActivities.description: River-side excavation near Vikramshila for trade route relics. Uncovering artifacts along the Ganges to understand ancient trade and monastic life at this Pala-era university.
explorationActivities.location: Antichak, near Bhagalpur on the Ganges, Bihar
